text: the first time i was exposed to aws as a

whoa i was simply blown away i decided
then
and there that this is the kind of

and this is the company that i want to
work for
for such a large organization you're
never just a cog in the machine
you have total ownership of your
projects and so it still feels like i'm
in a startup
at aws you have a blank canvas full of
possibilities
and opportunities to learn and grow
the arrival of the first ship to
annapolives and the arrival of the first
graviton tucci to aws
were certainly the two highlights of my
career that's the most exciting part of

when the new chip first arrives in the

get the feeling of how the new chip

i started a company three friends of
mine this company was called cloud
door six years later his company was
acquired by
amazon web services and today we are all
part of aws
people often ask me if that was a big
change
but really we're doing almost the same

only at a much larger scale the first
time i applied for a job at aws i didn't

but i did what i always do i kept on
learning and improving and here i am
today
a new curiosity would lead me to having
